thread.text:
I was at my local Microsoft store and they have a razor on display. Looks and feels very nice! 
Like a lot of phones once the excitement of the new phone wears off you start to see glaring issues. What if any issues would you say are present in the razor phone.

I've seen it as its sold in the UK on the three network....
.. I have a couple of concerns, but they might not be a factor for others.
1) building a phone is hard.. well thats the easy part.. but building a phone, and supporting the hardware, and producing updates, and committing to get them out to people for a couple of years isn't easy. Especially if this is your first handset and you're learning as you go (see Nextbit, Essential, Wileyfox etc...) I'm not sure how long this is going to be supported.
2) whilst the gaming performance is scoring well... the reviews have been disappointed by the camera performance.
3) I'm really not a phone gamer... so i'm not the target audience.
But i'd be really interested in anyones opinion. Especially if they've spent some quality time together.

replies.text:
It might be that I am drawn to new companies. I have the essential phone, and absolutely love this phone. I was an early adopter and have stuck with it since release. They have been solid on adressing issues and when google drops the update every month essential has it in the next couple days. 
For myself personally I don't care about the camera in a phone. Never have and frankly never will care about that. For those moments that I really want to remember I have a real camera that destroys the best of the best phone cameras. 
Seeing as Razer has established it's self with it's computers, they also unveiled project Linda. Which looks really interesting, the new companies are trying to make change. Literally every phone that comes out is just the same thing with a new processor and more RAM and a slightly better camera sensor.

thread.text:
Cool... Enjoy your new shiny phone and don't let me rain on your parade.
There is no such thing as a perfect phone, it's all about trading things off against each other.. and it's not a one size fits all approach.
Even if I seemed dismissive, I too want razor to succeed... If they bring innovation to android, every android user benefits.
Its not the right phone for me.... But thats the point.
What do you use yours for?

title: I have the Razer Phone — ask me questions!

thread.text: Here it is. Review soon. Until then, drop questions here and I'll do my best to answer them.
Don't want you to destroy your phone but is it waterproof or dust proof & can it do AR mode on Pokemon go?

Hello Alex, 
Does the razer phone have a notification led?

replies.text: Yep

thread.text: No water resistance. Haven't tried Pokemon Go, but no reason why it shouldn't work

Does it snap pics fast or slow? Is shutter lag present? Its pretty much the same size as the Nexus 6P right? do the buttons feel plastic? I heard they might be plastic but they look metal in the photos.

replies.text: It's fast. Power button/fingerprint feels a little plasticky.

thread.text: Does the screen get super bright? any light bleed?
Are those plastic antenna lines I see on the corners? o.O

Hey Alex 
Can't wait to get the phone!
- How good would you describe the speakers? I mean in comparison to other phones, are there anything even close to them?
What about the quality of the screen, when you watch youtube, videos etc.
And last, how does the DAC hold up against the lg v30?
Does it have a Gaming Mode / Gaming Tools similar to Samsung's where you can block notifications while playing?

replies.text: This I feel is one of the most important questions. Lol.

thread.text: How do you feel about the LCD display? Would you prefer a phone with an LCD display that runs at 120HZ or an OLED/AMOLED at 60?

replies.text: I'm easy. I think this phone's display looks great, and the 120Hz stuff is definitle visible in normal use. I prefer the colors of SuperAMOLED though.

thread.text:
- How responsive is the FP scanner?
- How pocketable is it?
- Would you say its slippery (laying on surfaces or in hand)?
- Apps2SD support?
- Website says a rear wide angle lense and telephoto.. Yet no video mentions the wideangle. Would you say its as wide as v30/g6?

replies.text:
- Very fast
- Surprisingly pocketable, but still big.
- Not that I can see, but there is adoptable storage
- Wide angle lens is just regular angle, not V30-style

thread.text: This looks like it's be a great multimedia phone, but does it really feel like it's "for gamers"? Is it actually great for multimedia?

replies.text: Yep. Speakers are super-loud, screen looks great and it's actually 16:9

thread.text: Does it feel smoother than a pixel like some are saying? does their software offer built in theme support?

replies.text: NopeFeels a bit like the Robin.Matter of personal taste on the speaker/bezels. Yes, you have to click the button to use the scanner.Depends on your priorities. Note 8 is a better all-round device for normals, but Razer isn't going for the mainstream market here.A little, but I'm still absolutely happy with the Pixel's responsiveness.

thread.text: Hey Alex, what's the clock speed and the Antutu Benchmark score?

Hello Alex! I currently have a note 8 and being an android junkie I'm always looking at new hardware. In your opinion is the razor phone a worthy compeitior to the note 8 and or a top tier android device. Early impressions?

replies.text: NopeFeels a bit like the Robin.Matter of personal taste on the speaker/bezels. Yes, you have to click the button to use the scanner.Depends on your priorities. Note 8 is a better all-round device for normals, but Razer isn't going for the mainstream market here.A little, but I'm still absolutely happy with the Pixel's responsiveness.

Note 8 is a better all-round device for normals, but Razer isn't going for the mainstream market here.A little, but I'm still absolutely happy with the Pixel's responsiveness.

thread.text: What's the back made of & how hot does it get with extensive gaming?

replies.text: It's big even for a 5.7in 16:9. If you have small hands, it's gonna be tough.Pretty well. Powers a pair of big studio headphones just fine, but has issues working with phones besides the Razer Phone.No problem using my middle finger (left hand) to do that.They can collect lint, but it's not terrible. I've certainly seen way worse in other phones like the Pixel 2 XL.I get the impression Razer has a roadmap here and this won't be a one-off. Nextbit was a scrappy startup, Razer is an established brand with a PC + accessory business making good money.Fine so far. Also this is metal, not plastic, which makes a big difference.Aluminum with a soft-touch anodized coating. Feels nice.
Thank you so much for letting me know!

thread.text: As we may know this phone is made by the team who made the Robin phone. And the Robin has durability issues. Mine developed micro factures and had to be replaced under warranty. I believe many other had that issue. Also it ended up on Zack "jerryrig's" wall of shame. SO what's the deal with the structure of the Razor phone? Is it built better? Did they learn from mistakes of the past? Or could this be an issue again?

Also this is metal, not plastic, which makes a big difference.Aluminum with a soft-touch anodized coating. Feels nice.

thread.text: Will this device meet the same demise​ as the Robin? The Robin got discontinued shortly after it was released. Should this company be trusted for longevity?

replies.text: The main difference is that Nextbit was a true startup, while Razer is a much bigger and well-established company. I'm not an analyst, but I'd guess that this was Razer's big reason for buying Nextbit -- to develop their own gaming phone. If the phone sells well, I'd guess that Razer will give good support, but if it crashes and burns, they might just consider it a failed experiment and stick with desktops.

Hopefully it goes better than the Forge TV I have somewhere collecting dust. 
Alex, how's the battery life with such a high powered screen? Does it dial back for mundane tasks or have a lower resolution setting?

It's big even for a 5.7in 16:9. If you have small hands, it's gonna be tough.Pretty well. Powers a pair of big studio headphones just fine, but has issues working with phones besides the Razer Phone.No problem using my middle finger (left hand) to do that.They can collect lint, but it's not terrible. I've certainly seen way worse in other phones like the Pixel 2 XL.I get the impression Razer has a roadmap here and this won't be a one-off. Nextbit was a scrappy startup, Razer is an established brand with a PC + accessory business making good money.Fine so far. thread.text:
It there anyway you could share the wallpapers? I saw a few that look good, so I am just asking. 
Also, I know there is no Verizon support, but any chance you could pop in a VZW Sim, in the small but highly unlikely possibility it supports VZW?
Is it really impressive?...or is it the same old "I like it because it's new?"

Thanks Alex. 
Now we await the review.

Hey Alex
I have a Xperia phone.Could you confirm if the DAC supports any Xperia xz1 or xz premium phones .
Or as a matter of fact how is the sq Inna different phone for the dac.

Hi Alex, does it have double tap to wake and how is the haptic feedback?
Also, can try downloading the Google Camera hdr+ port apk to see if it takes better photo quality and faster autofocusing?
Alex, from what you heard so far, will this get software and security updates regularly? I'd be concerned about support for this device.

replies.text:
Razer's track record isn't good. Their other phone, the Robin, is currently on the April '17 security update.
Also, they ended manufacturer warranty support of the phone while it was still being sold by many retailers. You can buy the Robin new on Amazon right now but Razer will not honor their warranty.

Can you really call the Robin, their phone? It was made by Nextbit. YES they bought Nextbit, but they had absolutely nothing to do with the design, production and sale of that phone. Robin(s) remaining in sales channels are most likely leftover models being sold by 3rd party groups, and NOT being sold by Razor.

thread.text:
I do get what you're saying but when a company buys another company they take both the good and the bad. They're taking on the liabilities of that other company. As far as I'm concerned, the Robin became Razers phone when they purchased Nextbit. Razer has been in complete control of whether or not the Robin gets security patches so I consider their track record with updates to be fair game. Also, the last update to the Robin dropped well after the buyout. Razer is aware that update left a crippling battery drain bug relating to Bluetooth that they have done nothing to fix. Again, to me, that goes on their support record.
Honoring a warranty is also part of an acquisition. And you're right, the ones on Amazon aren't being sold by Razer or Nextbit but the warranty cut off came before the last Nextbit sold units would have expired. All companies that I'm aware of still honor their warranties when purchased from other retailers if you have proof of purchase?
By the way, the Robin is still a great phone for the price, even without a warranty. I expect the Razer phone to be awesome. I'm just sceptical of Razer's support due to the way they've handled the Nextbit purchase.
Is the phone's camera as bad as Android Central make it out to be in there review?
Battery life? How is it?
I just got the Razer phone and I wonder why I get advertisements on the home screen when I leave apps an stuff? Is the same for you?
Does it support VoLTE for T-Mobile?
My fist impression of this phone was very positive. I love the feel of the phone and the screen. Wish it had an awesome camera and a stylist, that would make it perfect

So glad you are liking the phone! It seems great, for sure! How is the battery life and the display quality? Do you do a lot of gaming on your phone? I was recommending this device to my boyfriend the other day - it looks like a powerhouse!
it is pretty amazing
Does it have VoLTE for T-Mobile?

title: Which carriers does the Razer phone work on? (Verizon, Sprint, AT&T, etc.)

thread.text: Asking for a buddy - anyone know which carriers the Razer phone will work on?
att and t mobile
Are now available!
Has anyone had luck finding a great case?

I've always used Life Proof cases. They're water, dust, dirt, and drop resistant (up to I think 6 ft). They're very thin and durable.so you don't have to worry about it making your phone bulky. They are a little pricey, but totally worth it in my opinoin.
Just a side item if you are looking for minimal, the Vaja leather back for the iPhone 7+ will fit the back of the Razer. Takes care of the camera bump too
they had one at the MS store

Tudia makes some decent cases for the Razer phone. I picked up the Tudia slim-fit heavy duty one from Amazon for about $13. combine that with the Razer tempered glass screen cover, and it's some decent protection without adding any more heft to the phone. It adds some grip, and I've dropped it a couple of times, and the phone didn't even take a scratch.
It has all the correct port cutouts and button overlays (instead of having the whole bottom open, just the usb- c port is open, and there is a cutie for the power button/fingerprint scanner). Highly recommend.
went ahead with the tudia. solid case.

title: Is the Razer Phone the ULTIMATE Phone for Gamers?

thread.text:
So - I ask you - and especially any gamers out there... Is the Razer Phone the ultimate phone for gamers?
Razer says it isn't a gaming phone, but a phone built for gamers. There's a difference. Do you buy that? If you are into gaming, will this be your phone of choice?
I've got my eye on this phone as I play Pokemon go & the big battery seems perfect for the game seems it eats battery like nothing.

No  this is just another basic Android phone that is coming out to late in the year and will soon be overshadowed and forgotten about by the likes of the G7 and S9. Really don’t see a point for this phone, yet every major YouTuber is fawning over it for some apparent reason. Yes I know it has the 120hz display but that’s really it’s only real differentiator in hardware.

120 hz makes a big difference, since scrolling on a touchscreen is something we do nearly every time we use a mobile phone. 
-i use nova launcher. when i heard that this phone uses it as its launcher, i geeked out thinking about the performance optimization and immense customization that was probable.
-And that battery, ram, and speakers are something.
-i wanted pixel-like performance, but without that much Google on my face. So if the Razer is the same or a little better, then damn...

replies.text:
Cheaper too. I hear it will go for 699.
It may not have a jack, but the dongle has a 24bit DAC too, and AFAIK not sold separately.

thread.text: Feedback so far is not very stellar. Camera not too good, dim display, poor contrast and mediocre battery life. No 3.5 jack is less tolerable as a result IMO. Hopefully the S9+ has stereo speakers. Very very doubtful though.

replies.text: I've heard nothing but good things about this phone.

The S9 is rumored to get dual speakers tuned by Harman/AKG (Makes sense since Samsung bought them). But AFAIK the Razer dongle has a very good DAC.
As for the poor contrast, not really. People are just spoiled by AMOLED screens. LCDs will never compete on contrast. Mediocre battery life is sort of expected for me due to the higher than usual refresh rate and it's their first device anyway.

thread.text: The phone definitely comes with a BIG battery and a good-sized screen, plus the latest Snapdragon; which would all combine together to make mobile gaming more seamless. However, I do almost all of my gaming with consoles; so I probably wouldn't really be able to give a "knowledgeable" opinion on the subject.
2 days of battery life on moderate use on this phone sold me to it for sure.

title: Has anyone received a Razer Phone......?

thread.text: If so, what are your perceptions? Inquiring minds want to know!
I'd like to know too! Was interested in getting one but it's sadly way outside of my price range.
Best phone for me because of battery life imo.
it's great as long as you download a camera app. the one it comes with is very bad.
Hey guys here's a video of the teardown/disassembly of the Razer Phone in case anyone is interested in seeing the insides.

title: Has anyone recieved info on when to purchase?

thread.text: I was one of the first to submit my information to be notified to purchase the Razer phone when it went live. Phone release was supposed to be today but I never received an email on instructions on how to preorder. Whats going on?

replies.text: I received my link to order Tuesday night. You sure you were one of the first?
Definitely. I sat on the page refreshing while the site was crashing. Once it finally came up I jumped right in and put my info.

thread.text: Got my email around 11:30 pm Tuesday, but if you go to the site directly the order page is missing. Limited edition unavailable however. Put in my order with a case. Also getting a $30 CDN discount as well.
Link to actually purchase the phone and accessories is now working. Ordered the phone, glass screen protector, and thin and rugged cases.
And they canceled my order twice and now no cases are available. Told them to pound salt as I will spend my money elsewhere.
Anyone have some cool Razer themed wallpapers? If you do, please share 'em in here... I'm sure new Razer Phone users will appreciate once they get theirs!!!
I've used these before, but they're all designed for desktop. Really hoping they make some cool ones meant for mobile: http://forums.androidcentral.com/e?l...token=t-utb5Zt

And then I found these: https://assets.razerzone.com/eedownl...-1080x1920.pnghttps://assets.razerzone.com/eedownl...-1080x1920.pnghttps://assets.razerzone.com/eedownl..._1080x1920.png
Looks like they have some mobile ones!
Nice - I like that last set!!

In this video

, it seems that the phone will come with Razer logo wallpaper.

Looks pretty nice. And at $699, as I was watching the livestream. Available for reservation now and ships on the 17th.
Anyone interested?
I'll admit.....they are making it hard to say no...

replies.text: You know the irony is I just watched two different YouTube videos of the Razr phone it looks nice. Just not available in the states for CDMA on Verizon. The specs are gaming performance specs of course they're going to be great. Shockingly though, the price point is pretty darn good too.
700 bucks for a really good phone. That is hard to pass up.
It is. I already have my S8 but for everyone else it's not bad. About again it doesn't have the Verizon network requirements. Unless I'm mistaken it's not CDMA compatible.
Does it need CDMA for Verizon if it has all of Verizon's LTE frequencies? We are around two years before Verizon shuts down their CDMA network.
The Razer Phone doesn't even have Band 13, so it won't regardless. Which is a shame, because I would have bought it if it did work.
Looks to have potential however until phone's work with all carriers it's a no go for many
Yup yup, that's exactly what I'm saying!

thread.text: It does look super interesting! I'm intrigued, but not tempted... As of yet. 😜

replies.text: Like I say, I love my custom S8. Has more than enough battery for my needs good camera and it's the pixel set up via Nova Launcher for me. I'm not a gamer. I only have one game Of blocks on my phone and that's it.
I have a Pixel theme for my phone too! I'm happy with it too!

The Razer Phone doesn't even have Band 13, so it won't regardless. Which is a shame, because I would have bought it if it did work.
